intro: Apocopis himalayensis, commonly known as the Himalayan apocopis, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color.
